title: Southern regrets to inform you there is no trolley service, ever
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Southern regrets to inform you there is no trolley service, ever Southern says passengers prefer to buy snacks and coffee from station shops PA Wire Southern says passengers prefer to buy snacks and coffee from station shops PA Wire Lucy Holden Published at 12:01AM, July 24 2015 
A soggy ham sandwich, watery tea and two crumbly digestive biscuits couldn’t excite even the hungriest of customers, but for a harassed commuter halfway along the London to Brighton line, these bland snacks are little less than heaven. 
The on-board trolley service has been trundling down the aisles of Britain’s trains for decades, offering store-cupboard salvation to travellers. Now, a rail company has angered its customers by bringing an end to this fail-safe comfort, with only four days’ notice.
